tags: IM A SUCKER FOR SKATING AND TYRUS
summary: uh so summary of this is basically im redoing the jonah teaching cyrus to skate episode but with tyrus and no cyrus flying and...
body:
uh so summary of this is basically im redoing the jonah teaching cyrus to skate episode but with tyrus and no cyrus flying and jonah calling an ambulance

———————————

Skate Date

“Ready to learn to skate Cyrus?”

“Definitely.”

Its been months since the incident with Jonah when Cyrus broke his thumb and he really wanted to give skating another shot. He knew Jonah would probably teach him again if he asked but he’s seen Tj riding a lot and he figured he might have better luck with him. It definitely didn’t have anything to do with the fact that Cyrus had a fat crush on him. Nope. Definitely not.

Cyrus talked to Tj about it and the boy happily agreed to teach him after school one day, today just happened to be that day. They were outside on the sidewalk and Tj wanted to get him started off with the basics.

“Alright so we’re going to start off with simply riding-“ Cyrus cut him off mid sentence, warning him of his first experience. “I’m gonna stop you right there, I think I need to start with just learning how to stop the board.”

Tj let out a small laugh but he didn’t question Cyrus’s methods so he changed his plans a little. “Well thats simple enough, let me show you real quick.”

Tj rode a few feet and stopped the board, explaining to Cyrus along the way how he did it. “Now its your turn, step up and put one foot in the middle and one on the tail,” motioning to the places where he wanted Cyrus stand.

Cyrus followed and wobbled a little but managed to hold himself up pretty well. “Good now just push on your back foot so the front of the board goes up.” It took a few tries but he did it, although Tj had Cyrus repeat it a few times to make sure he had it down. “Now,” Tj added, “if you don’t feel comfortable stopping like that while riding just hop off. I’d rather risk the board than you.”

The younger boy thanked him but he could tell he definitely had a crush on Tj now. Cyrus didn’t have much time to think about it though, as Tj was already moving onto the next thing.

“Ok! I think you’re ready to get moving so just step on the board and grab my hands.”

Again, Cyrus did as he was told, positioning his feet to where he felt balanced and took both of Tj’s hands for extra support.

“Great I’m gonna start moving with you now, so take your back foot off and give a small push.” As Cyrus looked to the ground to see where he was putting his feet, Tj couldn’t help but look at him and notice how cute he looked today. The crush has been mutual for a while, so Tj was pretty excited when Cyrus asked him for help with skating.

After Cyrus pushed he repeated the steps and Tj gradually let go and Cyrus was going on his own. He had to jump off the board a few times but Tj didn’t mind, he just started and was honestly willing to help him with anything.

“Cyrus you’re doing awesome! You really picked it up!” Tj exclaimed. He wasn’t lying, Cyrus was making progress quickly and they both felt proud.

The last thing he wanted to teach Cyrus though was to ride off a curb and keep going. Tj helped him like when Cyrus was just beginning by grabbing his hands and balancing him as he skated off the curb. As soon as Cyrus did it on his own he ran up to Tj and hugged him.

“I did it! Thank you so much Teej! I can’t believe you were this patient, athletic things aren’t really my greatest point.”

“Its the least I can do underdog,” he smiled and his face grew red as Cyrus leaned up and kissed his cheek as a ‘thank you for the lesson’.

“Is there any chance you’d want to teach me again?” A huge smiled grew on Tj’s as he pulled Cyrus into another hug, resting his chin on his hug and replied, “definitely.”

tags: i'm not feeling my writing today
summary: Do you think Andi Mack is as the first truly intersectional feminist show on Disney Channel? I was rewatching the series...
question: Do you think Andi Mack is as the first truly intersectional feminist show on Disney Channel? I was rewatching the series compared to other Disney shows and I realized how subversive the show is.
answer:
I am not sure that I would give it the title of “the first truly intersectional feminist show on Disney Channel” for a number of reasons. I think that, like what I have explained about the gay representation on the show, Andi Mack is a step in the right direction as far as progress goes, but it is not the end goal. It is certainly the largest step Disney Channel has taken as far as intersectionality and feminist themes, but I think it would be unfair to choose one series to be the “first” to hold that title, considering how many other shows laid the ground work for Andi Mack to be what it is today. Choosing one definitive “first” makes it feel like a race to me, when in fact it is a never-ending journey.

That’s So Raven is a great example of that. One of the few series on the network to have a black main cast, and with episodes tackling racism, body image, and foster care - it was a big step towards progress as well. Along with that would be shows like Lizzie McGuire, The Proud Family, etc. Even in more recent years - the work Zendaya put into making sure KC Undercover centered around a black family and had feminist messages was super important in making Andi Mack what it is.

And while Andi Mack does have themes of intersectionality and feminism - it hasn’t really covered all of its bases. The show features racial diversity, different cultural traditions and belief systems, gay characters, some disability representation, and undertones of themes involving racism, feminism and equality - but many of the people who are most marginalized or who already experience the most intolerance are not represented. We don’t see any black or brown characters with dark skin. We don’t see any Muslim characters. We don’t see any fat characters. We don’t see any characters with visible physical disabilities. We don’t really see any poor characters (unless you count Amber). We don’t see any openly transgender or nonbinary characters. 

And while I don’t believe that it’s Andi Mack’s job to represent everyone to that degree, I think it just goes to show how much more progress there is to be made when it comes to normalizing intersectionality on TV in general, but especially in children’s TV.  Like I said in my pieces about sexuality on the show, we should NEVER erase the progress this show has made or what it stands for. The same goes for all of the shows that came before it with feminist themes and diversity. But the fact still stands that there is a long way to go and any shows that come after Andi Mack which cares about these same themes will still owe a lot of credit to this series for fighting for the ability to tell these stories.

I have another piece in my drafts that I’m working on which I’m going to address the way Andi Mack handles feminist themes through subtext so I’m not going to address that part as much here, but that will be coming eventually. It ties into this point very well but I think it will be better for me to split it into two. (Plus the other piece is in response to an ask that I got like 3 days before this one so I should really answer them eventually).

But the fact still stands that there is a long way to go and any shows that come after Andi Mack which cares about these same themes will still owe a lot of credit to this series for fighting for the ability to tell these stories.

I have another piece in my drafts that I’m working on which I’m going to address the way Andi Mack handles feminist themes through subtext so I’m not going to address that part as much here, but that will be coming eventually. It ties into this point very well but I think it will be better for me to split it into two. (Plus the other piece is in response to an ask that I got like 3 days before this one so I should really answer them eventually).

trail.content_raw:
I am not sure that I would give it the title of “the first truly intersectional feminist show on Disney Channel” for a number of reasons. I think that, like what I have explained about the gay representation on the show, Andi Mack is a step in the right direction as far as progress goes, but it is not the end goal. It is certainly the largest step Disney Channel has taken as far as intersectionality and feminist themes, but I think it would be unfair to choose one series to be the “first” to hold that title, considering how many other shows laid the ground work for Andi Mack to be what it is today. Choosing one definitive “first” makes it feel like a race to me, when in fact it is a never-ending journey.

That’s So Raven is a great example of that. One of the few series on the network to have a black main cast, and with episodes tackling racism, body image, and foster care - it was a big step towards progress as well. Along with that would be shows like Lizzie McGuire, The Proud Family, etc. Even in more recent years - the work Zendaya put into making sure KC Undercover centered around a black family and had feminist messages was super important in making Andi Mack what it is.

And while Andi Mack does have themes of intersectionality and feminism - it hasn’t really covered all of its bases. The show features racial diversity, different cultural traditions and belief systems, gay characters, some disability representation, and undertones of themes involving racism, feminism and equality - but many of the people who are most marginalized or who already experience the most intolerance are not represented. We don’t see any black or brown characters with dark skin. We don’t see any Muslim characters. We don’t see any fat characters. We don’t see any characters with visible physical disabilities. We don’t really see any poor characters (unless you count Amber). We don’t see any openly transgender or nonbinary characters. 

And while I don’t believe that it’s Andi Mack’s job to represent everyone to that degree, I think it just goes to show how much more progress there is to be made when it comes to normalizing intersectionality on TV in general, but especially in children’s TV.  Like I said in my pieces about sexuality on the show, we should NEVER erase the progress this show has made or what it stands for. The same goes for all of the shows that came before it with feminist themes and diversity. But the fact still stands that there is a long way to go and any shows that come after Andi Mack which cares about these same themes will still owe a lot of credit to this series for fighting for the ability to tell these stories.

I have another piece in my drafts that I’m working on which I’m going to address the way Andi Mack handles feminist themes through subtext so I’m not going to address that part as much here, but that will be coming eventually. It ties into this point very well but I think it will be better for me to split it into two. (Plus the other piece is in response to an ask that I got like 3 days before this one so I should really answer them eventually).
trail.content:
I am not sure that I would give it the title of “the first truly intersectional feminist show on Disney Channel” for a number of reasons. I think that, like what I have explained about the gay representation on the show, Andi Mack is a step in the right direction as far as progress goes, but it is not the end goal. It is certainly the largest step Disney Channel has taken as far as intersectionality and feminist themes, but I think it would be unfair to choose one series to be the “first” to hold that title, considering how many other shows laid the ground work for Andi Mack to be what it is today. Choosing one definitive “first” makes it feel like a race to me, when in fact it is a never-ending journey.

That’s So Raven is a great example of that. One of the few series on the network to have a black main cast, and with episodes tackling racism, body image, and foster care - it was a big step towards progress as well. Along with that would be shows like Lizzie McGuire, The Proud Family, etc. Even in more recent years - the work Zendaya put into making sure KC Undercover centered around a black family and had feminist messages was super important in making Andi Mack what it is.

And while Andi Mack does have themes of intersectionality and feminism - it hasn’t really covered all of its bases. The show features racial diversity, different cultural traditions and belief systems, gay characters, some disability representation, and undertones of themes involving racism, feminism and equality - but many of the people who are most marginalized or who already experience the most intolerance are not represented. We don’t see any black or brown characters with dark skin. We don’t see any Muslim characters. We don’t see any fat characters. We don’t see any characters with visible physical disabilities. We don’t really see any poor characters (unless you count Amber). We don’t see any openly transgender or nonbinary characters. 

And while I don’t believe that it’s Andi Mack’s job to represent everyone to that degree, I think it just goes to show how much more progress there is to be made when it comes to normalizing intersectionality on TV in general, but especially in children’s TV.  Like I said in my pieces about sexuality on the show, we should NEVER erase the progress this show has made or what it stands for. The same goes for all of the shows that came before it with feminist themes and diversity. But the fact still stands that there is a long way to go and any shows that come after Andi Mack which cares about these same themes will still owe a lot of credit to this series for fighting for the ability to tell these stories.

I have another piece in my drafts that I’m working on which I’m going to address the way Andi Mack handles feminist themes through subtext so I’m not going to address that part as much here, but that will be coming eventually. It ties into this point very well but I think it will be better for me to split it into two. (Plus the other piece is in response to an ask that I got like 3 days before this one so I should really answer them eventually).

summary: Regret
title: Regret
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2ShtNrd

by olympisisbeautiful

TJ regrets not telling Cyrus how he felt about him back in middle school. Now, with Cyrus’ girlfriend Iris and TJ’s girlfriend Cerina in the way, it’s too late. But several turns of events later, things are even more fucked up, and in the worst way possible.

blog.name: djheckingfruity
blog.title: Tyrus: Make That Ish Official
blog.description: Jay | She/her | 16 | Andi Mack said be gay do crime | Icon credit @tyrus-chips

summary: My favourite thing about TJ is that look he does towards Cyrus of asking for reasurence that everything is gonna be ok if he...
question: My favourite thing about TJ is that look he does towards Cyrus of asking for reasurence that everything is gonna be ok if he speaks what he wants to say. TJs like a boyfriend and pet puppy rolled into one and it's great
answer: In a sense, TJ looks up to Cyrus, and that’s why he looks to him for reassurance. He looks up to Cyrus without idolizing him though. And same goes for Cyrus, he looks up to TJ wirhout idolizing him. And that’s one of the many things that make their dynamic so healthy.

reblog.comment: In a sense, TJ looks up to Cyrus, and that’s why he looks to him for reassurance. He looks up to Cyrus without idolizing him though. And same goes for Cyrus, he looks up to TJ wirhout idolizing him. And that’s one of the many things that make their dynamic so healthy.

summary: Hence, The Prophecy
body:
Hence, The Prophecy

Finally got got around to posting it here. Sorry if it’s like, really bad. Comments (good or bad) are greatly appreciated. Also available on AO3.

Edit: Some things are worded a little differently now because tumblr doesn’t want me to do anything well.


Chapter 1: A Life-Changing Pain In The Butt


Have you ever wondered what it would like to be immortal? To live in a world of impossible powers and unimaginable adventure? Well, Cyrus hadn’t. He was fine living a peaceful life as a shepherd in the small village in Greece where he had been born, enjoying his life with his two best friends, Andi and Buffy. But you don’t always get what you want. That’s what he had learned from Apollo.


You know that trick Greek gods like to pull when they come to the land of mortals? You know, making themselves look old and feeble to see if anyone would help them? Yeah, that trick.


And Cyrus couldn’t resist because he loved being helpful! When he saw a limping old man walking through town, he couldn’t NOT ask if he could give him a meal and a bed for the night. He wasn’t an animal!

So Cyrus has taken the god Apollo, disguised as an old man into his house so that he could get warm.


“Would you like anything to eat”, Cyrus had asked the god as he helped him into the only chair he had in his small house.


“A bowl of soup would be nice, if you wouldn’t mind”, the god had said, barely hiding a grin from Cyrus as he went into the part of the house he used as his kitchen. He should’ve known then that something was up, but had ignored it to be polite.


Cyrus got a bowl and filled it with cold soup from last night. He wished he could warm it up, but he had run out of fire wood and Buffy wouldn’t be back for a few hours. The man assured him that it was fine and started eating.


And eating.


And eating.


The man had silently ate what was left in the pot from the night before(nearly three-quarters of a pot!) in the matter of a few hours.

Cyrus had planning to have that last him all week, saving up his food for a meeting in town that Saturday, but he tampered down his irritation, justifying the man’s actions by telling himself it was what he got for bringing in a hungry old man inside the house.


But then the man said, “Is that all you have?”


Cyrus jaw dropped. He was about to say something when the small door opened.


In came his two best friends, Andi with flower crowns and bracelets and Buffy trailing along with an armful of fire wood.


“Cyrus—Oh. Who’s this?”, Andi asked, looking at the man curiously. Buffy frowned and raised her eyebrow, shooting a disapproving look in Cyrus’s direction.


“Oh, um this is, um. Sorry sir, what was your name again?”, Cyrus asked the food-stealing old man in front of him, silently cursing that he was so polite.


The man only smiled as stood up. As he raised himself to his full height, transforming into a blond, muscled young man with tan skin and golden eyes. He grinned at the three mortals in front of him, showing perfect shining white teeth.


“I am Apollo”, Apollo said haughtily. “I had originally planned to visit this nasty old man who was bothering Demeter about something, but I stumbled into you instead.” He continued, his glowing eyes landing on Cyrus. “Ah, just as well, I was looking for an assistant anyway. And I guess I could give you two as Eros’s helpers, or maybe his mother would be more enclined for you two…”


“Wait, excuse me?”, Buffy asked, incredulous as the god started trailing off.


“I”, the god said, proudly. “Am giving you three the gift of eternal life!”


His declaration was met with blank stares.


“Why?”, Andi finally asked.


“Why? Because I’m feeling generous! Anyone would love to become a god, even a minor one, so are you ready to become servants to the gods?”


The three looked at each other. Gods? Immortal life? They could be working together for ever. The girls had excited looks on their faces, but Cyrus was a little skeptical. But seeing his friends faces, how could he say no. Besides, it couldn’t be that bad, right?


The three mortals took one final look at each other and nodded to Apollo.

Immediately they were swept up into a swirling vortex of golds and yellows and reds and then suddenly, they were standing in the courtyard of a magnificent palace, the building reaching higher than the three of them could see. All around them was beautiful homes and gardens and temples and they were overwhelmed.


Then, they felt a warmth in their chests. They started to glow and they were heated from the inside out. The heat and the light came to its apex and then receded into whatever place it had come from.


“There”, Apollo said. “You are now gods.”


“That’s it?”, Andi asked, but the god just rolled his eyes.


“What are we supposed to do now?”, Cyrus asked.


“That!”, came a thundering voice. “Is an excellent question.”


In front of them appeared a young girl, about sixteen, shining like the moon on the darkest night.


“My brother”, the lady Artemis said, “Who have you brought here today?”


The three friends bowed to the lady as she approached, less surprised but still in awe of the goddess.


“Sister Artemis! I’m glad you have come. I’m sure one of these girls would prove useful in your hunt!”


One of them? They were being split up? He was about to raise the question when he saw the look on Buffy’s face. Artemis’s hunt was legendary, a place for young women to run with the awe-inspiring goddess. Buffy had grown up hunting with her brothers, it was something she had only dreamed about. For her happiness, Cyrus could stand not seeing them everyday. And if anyone deserved to be in the hunt, it was Buffy.


Artemis seemed to agree. “You”, she said, looking intently at the newly-made minor goddess. “You have a strong heart and great skills. You would be a fine addition to the hunt. But I must warn you that you can not have any romantic relationship while you are in the hunt. Do you still wish to join?”


Buffy looked into the goddess’s eyes, determined. “I understand, my lady. And I would wish to join your ranks.”


After that it was a flurry of goodbyes and promises that they would see each other plenty, from both the lifelong friends and the gods, and then Buffy and her patron were gone.


Andi was about to ask about her role, when a woman draped in flowers came down the path with a lady in a dress made of wheat. These two women were of course Persephone and her mother Demeter.


The two women stopped in front of the new godlings. The flowers on Andi’s arms and head seemed to catch Persephone’s eye and they were suddenly discussing flower arrangements. It wasn’t long before Andi was also swept away, the new haindmaiden of the goddess of flowers and springtime.


“What am I supposed to do now?”, Cyrus wondered aloud, forgetting about the god on his left.


“Well I thought that would be obvious”, Apollo said, grinning. “You will be working for me.”


And that was what Cyrus was doing. And honestly? He loved it. He loved helping a doctor make a new medication, he loved helping a poet complete one last play, he even liked taking care of Apollo’s sun horses. Apollo was a little annoying, but overall, he was a good patron.


The prophecies, though. Those were trouble.

reblog.comment:
Hence, The Prophecy

Finally got got around to posting it here. Sorry if it’s like, really bad. Comments (good or bad) are greatly appreciated. Also available on AO3.

And I guess I could give you two as Eros’s helpers, or maybe his mother would be more enclined for you two…”


“Wait, excuse me?”, Buffy asked, incredulous as the god started trailing off.


“I”, the god said, proudly. “Am giving you three the gift of eternal life!”


His declaration was met with blank stares.


“Why?”, Andi finally asked.


“Why? Because I’m feeling generous! Anyone would love to become a god, even a minor one, so are you ready to become servants to the gods?”


The three looked at each other. Gods? Immortal life? They could be working together for ever. The girls had excited looks on their faces, but Cyrus was a little skeptical. But seeing his friends faces, how could he say no. Besides, it couldn’t be that bad, right?


The three mortals took one final look at each other and nodded to Apollo.

Immediately they were swept up into a swirling vortex of golds and yellows and reds and then suddenly, they were standing in the courtyard of a magnificent palace, the building reaching higher than the three of them could see. All around them was beautiful homes and gardens and temples and they were overwhelmed.


Then, they felt a warmth in their chests. They started to glow and they were heated from the inside out. The heat and the light came to its apex and then receded into whatever place it had come from.


“There”, Apollo said. “You are now gods.”


“That’s it?”, Andi asked, but the god just rolled his eyes.


“What are we supposed to do now?”, Cyrus asked.


“That!”, came a thundering voice. “Is an excellent question.”


In front of them appeared a young girl, about sixteen, shining like the moon on the darkest night.


“My brother”, the lady Artemis said, “Who have you brought here today?”


The three friends bowed to the lady as she approached, less surprised but still in awe of the goddess.


“Sister Artemis! I’m glad you have come. I’m sure one of these girls would prove useful in your hunt!”


One of them? They were being split up? He was about to raise the question when he saw the look on Buffy’s face. Artemis’s hunt was legendary, a place for young women to run with the awe-inspiring goddess. Buffy had grown up hunting with her brothers, it was something she had only dreamed about. For her happiness, Cyrus could stand not seeing them everyday. And if anyone deserved to be in the hunt, it was Buffy.


Artemis seemed to agree. “You”, she said, looking intently at the newly-made minor goddess. “You have a strong heart and great skills. You would be a fine addition to the hunt. But I must warn you that you can not have any romantic relationship while you are in the hunt. Do you still wish to join?”


Buffy looked into the goddess’s eyes, determined. “I understand, my lady. And I would wish to join your ranks.”


After that it was a flurry of goodbyes and promises that they would see each other plenty, from both the lifelong friends and the gods, and then Buffy and her patron were gone.


Andi was about to ask about her role, when a woman draped in flowers came down the path with a lady in a dress made of wheat. These two women were of course Persephone and her mother Demeter.


The two women stopped in front of the new godlings. The flowers on Andi’s arms and head seemed to catch Persephone’s eye and they were suddenly discussing flower arrangements. It wasn’t long before Andi was also swept away, the new haindmaiden of the goddess of flowers and springtime.


“What am I supposed to do now?”, Cyrus wondered aloud, forgetting about the god on his left.


“Well I thought that would be obvious”, Apollo said, grinning. “You will be working for me.”


And that was what Cyrus was doing. And honestly? He loved it. He loved helping a doctor make a new medication, he loved helping a poet complete one last play, he even liked taking care of Apollo’s sun horses. Apollo was a little annoying, but overall, he was a good patron.


The prophecies, though. Those were trouble.
trail.content:
Hence, The Prophecy

Finally got got around to posting it here. Sorry if it’s like, really bad. Comments (good or bad) are greatly appreciated. Also available on AO3.

Edit: Some things are worded a little differently now because tumblr doesn’t want me to do anything well.


Chapter 1: A Life-Changing Pain In The Butt


Have you ever wondered what it would like to be immortal? To live in a world of impossible powers and unimaginable adventure? Well, Cyrus hadn’t. He was fine living a peaceful life as a shepherd in the small village in Greece where he had been born, enjoying his life with his two best friends, Andi and Buffy. But you don’t always get what you want. That’s what he had learned from Apollo.


You know that trick Greek gods like to pull when they come to the land of mortals? You know, making themselves look old and feeble to see if anyone would help them? Yeah, that trick.


And Cyrus couldn’t resist because he loved being helpful! When he saw a limping old man walking through town, he couldn’t NOT ask if he could give him a meal and a bed for the night. He wasn’t an animal!

So Cyrus has taken the god Apollo, disguised as an old man into his house so that he could get warm.


“Would you like anything to eat”, Cyrus had asked the god as he helped him into the only chair he had in his small house.


“A bowl of soup would be nice, if you wouldn’t mind”, the god had said, barely hiding a grin from Cyrus as he went into the part of the house he used as his kitchen. He should’ve known then that something was up, but had ignored it to be polite.


Cyrus got a bowl and filled it with cold soup from last night. He wished he could warm it up, but he had run out of fire wood and Buffy wouldn’t be back for a few hours. The man assured him that it was fine and started eating.


And eating.


And eating.


The man had silently ate what was left in the pot from the night before(nearly three-quarters of a pot!) in the matter of a few hours.

Cyrus had planning to have that last him all week, saving up his food for a meeting in town that Saturday, but he tampered down his irritation, justifying the man’s actions by telling himself it was what he got for bringing in a hungry old man inside the house.


But then the man said, “Is that all you have?”


Cyrus jaw dropped. He was about to say something when the small door opened.


In came his two best friends, Andi with flower crowns and bracelets and Buffy trailing along with an armful of fire wood.


“Cyrus—Oh. Who’s this?”, Andi asked, looking at the man curiously. Buffy frowned and raised her eyebrow, shooting a disapproving look in Cyrus’s direction.


“Oh, um this is, um. Sorry sir, what was your name again?”, Cyrus asked the food-stealing old man in front of him, silently cursing that he was so polite.


The man only smiled as stood up. As he raised himself to his full height, transforming into a blond, muscled young man with tan skin and golden eyes. He grinned at the three mortals in front of him, showing perfect shining white teeth.


“I am Apollo”, Apollo said haughtily. “I had originally planned to visit this nasty old man who was bothering Demeter about something, but I stumbled into you instead.” He continued, his glowing eyes landing on Cyrus. “Ah, just as well, I was looking for an assistant anyway. And I guess I could give you two as Eros’s helpers, or maybe his mother would be more enclined for you two…”


“Wait, excuse me?”, Buffy asked, incredulous as the god started trailing off.


“I”, the god said, proudly. “Am giving you three the gift of eternal life!”


His declaration was met with blank stares.


“Why?”, Andi finally asked.


“Why? Because I’m feeling generous! Anyone would love to become a god, even a minor one, so are you ready to become servants to the gods?”


The three looked at each other. Gods? Immortal life? They could be working together for ever. The girls had excited looks on their faces, but Cyrus was a little skeptical. But seeing his friends faces, how could he say no. Besides, it couldn’t be that bad, right?


The three mortals took one final look at each other and nodded to Apollo.

Immediately they were swept up into a swirling vortex of golds and yellows and reds and then suddenly, they were standing in the courtyard of a magnificent palace, the building reaching higher than the three of them could see. All around them was beautiful homes and gardens and temples and they were overwhelmed.


Then, they felt a warmth in their chests. They started to glow and they were heated from the inside out. The heat and the light came to its apex and then receded into whatever place it had come from.


“There”, Apollo said. “You are now gods.”


“That’s it?”, Andi asked, but the god just rolled his eyes.


“What are we supposed to do now?”, Cyrus asked.


“That!”, came a thundering voice. “Is an excellent question.”


In front of them appeared a young girl, about sixteen, shining like the moon on the darkest night.


“My brother”, the lady Artemis said, “Who have you brought here today?”


The three friends bowed to the lady as she approached, less surprised but still in awe of the goddess.


“Sister Artemis! I’m glad you have come. I’m sure one of these girls would prove useful in your hunt!”


One of them? They were being split up? He was about to raise the question when he saw the look on Buffy’s face. Artemis’s hunt was legendary, a place for young women to run with the awe-inspiring goddess. Buffy had grown up hunting with her brothers, it was something she had only dreamed about. For her happiness, Cyrus could stand not seeing them everyday. And if anyone deserved to be in the hunt, it was Buffy.


Artemis seemed to agree. “You”, she said, looking intently at the newly-made minor goddess. “You have a strong heart and great skills. You would be a fine addition to the hunt. But I must warn you that you can not have any romantic relationship while you are in the hunt. Do you still wish to join?”


Buffy looked into the goddess’s eyes, determined. “I understand, my lady. And I would wish to join your ranks.”


After that it was a flurry of goodbyes and promises that they would see each other plenty, from both the lifelong friends and the gods, and then Buffy and her patron were gone.


Andi was about to ask about her role, when a woman draped in flowers came down the path with a lady in a dress made of wheat. These two women were of course Persephone and her mother Demeter.


The two women stopped in front of the new godlings. The flowers on Andi’s arms and head seemed to catch Persephone’s eye and they were suddenly discussing flower arrangements. It wasn’t long before Andi was also swept away, the new haindmaiden of the goddess of flowers and springtime.


“What am I supposed to do now?”, Cyrus wondered aloud, forgetting about the god on his left.


“Well I thought that would be obvious”, Apollo said, grinning. “You will be working for me.”


And that was what Cyrus was doing. And honestly? He loved it. He loved helping a doctor make a new medication, he loved helping a poet complete one last play, he even liked taking care of Apollo’s sun horses. Apollo was a little annoying, but overall, he was a good patron.


The prophecies, though. Those were trouble.
